results.title: Liebelei
results.brief_description: Vienna, 1910; a whirlwind love affair between Fritz, a young lieutenant in the Austro-Hungarian Army, and Christine, the shy and sensitive daughter of a musician, ends in tragedy. Ophuls freely adapted Schnitzler’s play in which Christine’s great love is just another affair for the dissolute lieutenant already involved with a baroness. In the film Fritz’s affair with the baroness has more or less ended and the couple’s expression of undying love (not entirely cynical on his part), is threatened by the baron’s vengefulness - the portrayal, in the play, of innocence destroyed by cynical players in a decadent society gives way to Ophuls’ atmospheric portrayal of love doomed by hollow class distinction and hidebound notions of honour. Cast includes Magda Schneider, Wolfgang Liebeneiner and Gustaf Grundgens. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Liam [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: BBC, Liam Films, Colin McKeown, Martin Tempia and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Directed by Stephen Frears (High Fidelity, The Van, The Grifters, The Snapper) “Liam” is the story of a working class Catholic family, living in Liverpool in the 1930s. Liam (Anthony Borrows), is a seven year old boy, whose parents, older sister and brother, live in conditions that could best be described as poor but happy. Liam’s father (Ian Hart) works on the Liverpool docks, a job he holds with great pride. Liam is a mostly silent child, pathologically shy with a terrible stutter. With his First Holy Communion looming, Liam faces his religious fears as he is constantly reminded of the fires of hell awaiting sinners. Meanwhile Teresa, Liam’s sister, has been employed by a wealthy Jewish family as a maid and faces a moral dilemma as she becomes embroiled in the extra-marital affairs of her boss. When Liam’s father loses work, his world is thrown into chaos, and looking for direction Dad is drawn to fascism. Con, Liam’s brother, threatens Dad’s role as breadwinner as he is employed and keeping the family afloat financially. Liam’s mother gallantly tries to hold the family unit together in the face of ensuing violence and division. Written by Jimmy McGovern (Priest, Go now).

results.title: Lethal weapon 4
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Joel Silver and Richard Donner
results.brief_description: In this fourth instalment of the Lethal Weapon series Mel Gibson and Danny Glover reprise their roles as Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh - a pair of mismatched police detectives who over the course of their relationship have learnt to love and appreciate each other’s contrasting styles. The over-the-top opening sequence establishes what the film has in store - glib throwaway lines, explosive action segments and faint hints at the importance of friendship to these two old buddies. Both Martin and Roger face a period of transition - Martin is to become a father (with Internal Affairs officer Lorna Cole - played by Rene Russo) whilst Roger is to become a grandfather. And the bad guys? Well represented by the Chinese triads who are involved with an illegal people-smuggling ring. Highlights of this film are the fight sequences, featuring Asian star Jet Li, staged by Hong Kong director Corey Yuen. Chris Rock (utilising his signature frenetic comedic shtick) plays a new cop on the block with unstinting passion for his job.

results.title: Les Diaboliques
results.brief_description: A sadistic headmaster at a private boy’s school is murdered by his long suffering wife and his brutalised mistress (Simone Signoret). But when the two women return to the school and pretend no knowledge of the headmaster’s disappearance they are unsettled by the schoolboys’ sightings of his “ghost”. Clouzot’s famous horror film is imbued with a dark, malevolent atmosphere and perversity seems to lurk behind every corner. On its release the film was justly celebrated as an innovative contribution to horror filmmaking, and though much of Clouzot’s staging has been copied by subsequent generations of horror filmmakers, few have managed to equal the chilling power of the original. Based on the book “Celle qui N’Etait Plus” by Pierre Boileau and Thomas Narcejac (who also wrote “Vertigo”).

results.title: Leo Tolstoy's Anna Karenina
results.creator_credit: ICON, Bruce Davey and Bernard Rose
results.brief_description: This adaptation of the Leo Tolstoy masterpiece, “Anna Karenin”, is noted for its stunning cinematography of the foggy Russian landscape. The screenplay is a faithful but abridged version of the novel set in 1880s Russia. The heroine, Anna (Sophie Marceau), is not happy in her marriage to the staid Karenin (James Fox), despite the joy she finds in their son. When she meets Count Vronsky (Sean Bean) in Moscow, where she goes to sort out the marriage problems of her brother, her life is turned upside-down. Their passionate affair causes her to lose her standing in society, being an unfaithful woman, to lose her son and eventually to lose the happiness she so desperately craved. The story is a tragic reminder of the downfall of a woman who dares to rebel against the rules of society. This affair is paralleled by the romance between Levin (Alfred Molina), the narrator of the story who is said to represent Tolstoy, and the young Kitty (Mia Kirshner), who had been in love with Vronsky until Anna captured his attentions. In English with occasional Russian dialogue subtitled in English.

results.title: Lenny
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Martin Worth Productions, Marvin Worth and Bob Fosse
results.brief_description: Lenny Bruce, scrounging for laughs in the lowest dives, in a complex relationship with Honey, the sleazy stripper whom he married, and which dissolved into sordid self-destruction for both, was a folk hero of his time. Now saint, now sadist, now prophet, now punk, Lenny’s character was elusive, shaping itself into the form desired by the beholder. At times this film takes on the ‘cinema-verite’ style with interviews of major figures in Lenny’s life and flashback sequences to nightclub routines and events in the distant past. This tense, dynamic film fuses disparate time frames to produce an emotionally charged but never one-sided characterisation of Lenny Bruce. Dustin Hoffman and Valerie Perrine are excellent in their roles as the ill-fated Lenny and Honey.

results.title: Leningrad Cowboys go America
results.creator_credit: Villealfa Filmproductions, Svenska filminstitutet, Klas Oloffson, Aki Kaurismaki and Katinka Farago
results.brief_description: Somewhere in the wastelands of the Soviet Union lives the worst rock- “rock-‘n”-roll” band in the world; an outfit with no audience and no commercial potential. They decide to bury their national sentiments and go to the United States to try their luck. This film is the riotiously funny account of their journey over the ocean and across the continent; a story of steamy bars and honest folks in the backyards of the Hamburger Nation.

results.title: Legends of the fall [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Edward Zwick, Patrick Crowley and Marshall Herskovitz
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Jim Harrison, this sweeping period saga of three brothers, their powerful father and a beautiful women loved by them all, is set against lush Montana scenery. The film covers decades in the lives of Alfred (Aidan Quinn), Tristan (Brad Pitt) and Samuel (Henry Thomas) Ludlow, the sons of retired military man William Ludlow (Anthony Hopkins). Raised by the unorthodox Ludlow after the departure of their mother, the boys grew up close, sharing an appreciation of the land and a pioneering spirit. The family becomes divided however, when young Sam enlists in World War I over his father’s objections, and his brothers follow suit to protect him. Sam dies in battle, leaving Alfred and Tristan to return home and deal with the lingering torment. Further complicating matters is the presence of Sam’s beautiful fiancee, Susannah (Julia Ormond). After Sam’s death she attracts the attentions of both the responsible Alfred and the brooding Tristan, a conflict that threatens to drive the brothers apart forever.

results.title: Legend
results.creator_credit: Legend Productions, Arnon Milchan and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: Legend is a fairytale produced on a grand scale, set in a timeless world peopled with fairies, elves, goblins, trolls and demons. It is the story of Jack (Tom Cruise), a young heroic peasant who takes his sweetheart, the beautiful princess Lili (Mia Sara), to see the most powerful creatures on earth, the last surviving unicorns. Unknown to the young lovers, Darkness (Satan) played to perfection by Tim Curry is using the innocence of Lili to set a trap to capture and destroy the creatures of light, the golden-horned unicorns. Children of all ages will be entranced by the magnificent make-up effects, from the smallest elves to the giant Darkness. The latter is unquestionably the most impressive depiction of Satan ever brought to the screen. It is a classic story of good and evil, love and hate.
